Wherever I go I always want to support local and enjoy a good coffee. After doing a bit of research I found this lovely little coffee stop and took a walk to go and find it. It's just off the main road as you walk...towards Gregory lake, a perfect pit stop.
The coffee is delicious and roasted on site! Pure Sri Lankan beans. The food was different but in all the right ways, it's local, fresh and exciting. I had the pulled Jack fruit on toast which was a special whilst my friend enjoyed banana bread and we both had a couple coffees. The hosts/ owners are lovely and speak great English. It's also amazing to see the social project side, where they are trying to get more women into work k/business etc... All on their website.
Take a little walk/tuk tuk ride out of town and stop here, you won't be dissapointed. I hope it goes from strength to streng towards Gregory lake, a perfect pit stop.

a really nice place a little off center with good food and really good coffee and the best moment was when the hostess spoke in German to me and I asked her where she learned it and she said she is from my Hometown ......I guess I looked a little dumbstrucked ... such a nice meenzer medsche as we say where I come from  I guess I looked a little dumbstrucked ... such a nice meenzer medsche as we say where I come from ...

Wish we had tried some of the food as the menu looked gre in the garden while us adults had our delicious coffees and teas. Definitely worth a stop.
